events.name: DevFest Bayern
events.description:
DevFest Bayern is a community-run event that offers speaker sessions across multiple product areas (Mobile, Web, Cloud, ML). It is organized by the Google Developer Groups (GDGs) of Munich, Regensburg, Erlangen-N√ºrnberg and Passau.

Call for Papers submission deadline is August 27th, 2017.
You will be notified about the state of your submission by September 3rd, 2017 at the latest.

IMPORTANT

REGISTRATION INFOS WILL BE SEND OUT LATER!

When? Saturday - November 25th, 2017

How?1 day - 2 tracks - 10 Minutes - Lightning talks, quick introduction of new technologies
- 20 Minutes - Short tech talks
- 40 Minutes - Full featured tech talks

JOIN US AS A SPEAKER

https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLSfYY7zy7jRCxcv5peMJL-O6KYvujJQIyL_xg4cIipYc3e4H1w/viewform?fbzx=7147388518440184000

events.name: Google Cloud Study Jam
events.description:
‚Ä¢ Was wir unternehmen werden
Join us on this special valentines event! It's hands on, so bring your laptop!

Want to get started on the Google Cloud, but don't know where to begin?
Join us for our Cloud Study Jam! Together we'll work through three Google Cloud Platform Essentials labs, then you will get free access to the next quest so you can finish this series of labs at home to get a Google-hosted badge for your online profile. You will be able to get hands-on experience with Docker, Kubernetes and Scientific Data Processing, which will earn you additional badges.
Join this meetup to get official Google training, a $70+ value, free of charge.
Bring a laptop (PC, Mac or Chromebook)! The labs will run on all of the latest versions of the popular browsers. For the best experience, make sure your laptop has Firefox or Chrome installed.

Agenda:
6:30pm: Three Google Cloud Platform Essentials labs
8:00pm: Break
8:30pm: Intro to Docker or Scientific Data Processing lab
22:00pm: Event ends

If you cannot make it please remove yourself from the list, so that others have the chance to join registration will close on Feb 12.

Please keep an eye on the event as we will share more infos :)

‚Ä¢ Was sollst du mitbringen
Bring a laptop (PC, Mac or Chromebook)!

‚Ä¢ Wichtig zu wissen

events.name: Google Cloud Meetup  January - Istio & KNative
events.description:
Long time no see. We start fresh in 2019 with the first meetup in january.

Also i'm happy that we move to the place of our first meetup 2 years ago to SinnerSchrader (https://sinnerschrader.com/). We are grateful, that they are providing us with space and food for our upcoming meetup

As always we are looking for a place to host our Meetup and we are looking for speakers in all topics regarding cloud infrastructure.

For this evening we have the following schedule:

19:00 Meet & Greed & Pizza
19.30 Whats new in Google Cloud
19.45 - Lightning Talk Slot
20.00 - A quick introduction to Istio - The latest open source project out of google is here to help you make your service-to-service communication safe, performant and reliable. Let's get a quick introduction
- Mario Fahlandt
20.30 - Knative is a developer friendly project build on top of kubernetes and istio that allows developers to deploy code directly to the cluster and run it even with zero replicas scaling on demand. This presentation will discuss and demonstrate the features of Knative.
- Randy Gupta is a Google Developer Expert for Cloud and also Organizer of the GDG D√ºsseldorf. With a professional experience of more 20 years in software development he is focused today on building microservices applications on top of kubernetes.
21.00 socializing

Looking forward to see you!

events.name: Cloud Study Jam - Kubernetes
events.description:
Details
Weeee! We are doing annother StudyJam this time Kubernetes!

Join us in the Isar Valley @ Google Office for our next StudyJam! Please answer the RSVP Question, so we can register your name.

Want to get started on the Google Cloud, but don't know where to begin? Join us for our Cloud Study Jam!
Get official Google training, a $55+ value, free of charge. Together we'll work through several Google Cloud labs. You will get hands-on experience with the Cloud Console, Kubernetes, Security, IoT on Cloud, and Machine Learning.
Then after our live session, you will have free access to more labs you can finish at home. Complete all labs in the quest and earn a Google-hosted badge for your online profile, and additional 30 days access to the training platform to compete any labs you want
Bring a laptop and charger (PC, Mac or Chromebook)! The labs will run on all of the latest versions of the popular browsers. For the best experience, make sure your laptop has Firefox or Chrome installed. Don‚Äôt forget your charger.

What will we do?
1. Distributed Load Testing Using Kubernetes
2. Managing Deployments Using Kubernetes Engine
3. Awwvision: Cloud Vision API from a Kubernetes Cluster
Bonus: Build a Slack Bot with Node.js on Kubernetes

6:00: Get together
6:30pm: Start Study Jam
7:30pm: Break
8:00pm: Study Jam Part 2

10:00pm: End

events.name: Special Meetup: Breaking a world record using GCP! Also: First Look Cloud Run!
events.description:
As promised we have a special treat for all of you!

Emma Haruka Iwao‚Äã is comming to munich to tell us how she and her team managed to break the record with the help of GCP
She has calculated 31.4 trillion digits of Pi in 2019 and broke the world record in the Pi computation. The process took about four months and 200 TiB of storage. Record-breaking Pi calculations have traditionally been done on supercomputers and special-made hardware, but Emma and her team did it on Cloud for the first time.

This talk will discuss the nature of the calculation, the architecture, challenges and techniques, and of course the brief history of Pi computation. Calculating Pi has been the speaker's childhood dream and this talk will also explain how the small dream grew to the new world record.

- Emma is a Japanese computer scientist and cloud developeradvocate at Google. After joining Google in 2015, Iwao became a Cloud Developer Advocate in 2017. She originallyworked for Google in Tokyo, before moving to Seattle in 2019. Iwao focuses on the use of theGoogle Cloud Platform (GCP), as well as supporting application developers. She works to makecloud computing accessible for everyone, creating online demos and teaching materials.

And I'm also thrilled to announce that Yevgen will go Cloudless with Cloud Run!

Cloud Run offers a ton of benefits for developers and cloud practitioners. In this talk, we will cover life-cycle for your code and get to know the latest updates on serverless compute stack with practical use cases.

- Eug√©n (Twitter: @batovsky): GDG Munich Cloud Co-organizer, works as a senior consultant for Data Reply in Munich. Previously he worked at digital publishing, tier 1 investment banking and web search engine with a focus on making infrastructure platforms for engineers more reliable. He learned about computer systems at Sevastopol Technical University.

!!!IMPORTANT!!!
Please leave your First & Lastname in the question answer, we need it for security reasons :)

TIMETABLE
18.30 -19.00 Get Together & Food
19.00 - 19.45 - Cloudless with Cloud Run - Eug√©n
19.45 - 20.30 - Breaking a world record using GCP: most accurate value of Pi - Emma Haruka Iwao
20.30 - 21.30 Drinks \o/

We are also looking for a venue in September and talks for September so if you are interested reach out to us :)

events.name: Google Cloud Summit 2019
events.description:
Let's meet together on Google Cloud Summit on September 19!

Here is the link for registration, in case you forget to register:

https://inthecloud.withgoogle.com/summit-mun-19-en/home.html?utm_source=Devrel&utm_medium=email&utm_campaign=FY19-Q3-emea-summit-operational-er-devrel

We will be there all day near Google for Developers & Startups booth.

And there you can save your spot for an evening in wonderful Munich brewery. We reserve only 20 spots so please checkin at the booth and confirm that you will come. Tickets are distributed on a first-come, first-serve basis.

Please be aware that this event is not sponsored so there will be no free drinks or dinner :)

See you!

-Yevgen

events.name: Collaboration Meetup:¬†Deep dive into some modern NLP with hands-on on GPUs/TPUs
events.description:
Our next special meetup will be done in the shape of collaboration between GDG Cloud Munich and Hacking Machine Learning.

Please register to save your spot here: https://www.meetup.com/Hacking-Machine-Learning/events/264153424/

We will have Cesar Ilharco Magalhaes, a software engineer from Google Research & Machine Intelligence / Google Assistant / News Intelligence and Realtime Event Understanding in Zurich. Participants will get exposed to state-of-the-art NLP architectures and techniques (Attention, Transformers, BERT), understand them conceptually and apply them to practical problems, for instance by training Transformers models and fine-tuning pertained BERT with Colab running on Cloud GPUs/TPUs.

Do not forget your laptop and power supply!!

See you at the meetup!

events.name: Developing with Machine Learning with or without expertise
events.description:
Let's kick start new journey into 2020 with our great friends Stylight HQ.

‚è∞ Schedule:
‚Ä¢ 18:30 - 18:50: üçïDoors open
‚Ä¢ 18:50 - 19:00: üì¢ Announcements
‚Ä¢ üé§ Laurent Picard
Building smarter solutions with no expertise in machine learning.
‚Ä¢ üé§Zack Akil
Safer cycling with an Edge TPU watching your back
‚Ä¢ üé§Polong Lin
Machine learning at scale with BigQuery, Colab and AI Platform notebooks on Google Cloud
‚Ä¢ 21:30 - 22:00: Networking

üîò Laurent Picard ‚Äì Building smarter solutions with no expertise in machine learning.

ML? API? AutoML? What can we build in only a few hours or days? In this session, we'll see how to benefit from existing ML models and how to create a custom model with AutoML techniques. We‚Äôll also be active players of a live demo, so don't put your smartphone on airplane mode!

Laurent is a developer passionate about software, hardware, science, and everything shaping the future. He works for Google Cloud where he enjoys exploring and sharing what's possible. In a prior life, he pioneered the ebook industry, co-created the 1st European ebook reader, and co-founded Bookeen.

üîò Zack Akil ‚Äì Safer cycling with an Edge TPU watching your back

Cycling in central London is an extreme sport! To give me the competitive edge I've built a machine vision model that runs on an Edge TPU that keeps me informed about the dangerous vehicles that are behind me in blistering real time. I'll show you the end-to-end process of developing and deploying the model to the recently released Edge TPU hardware from Google.

Zack is a developer advocate for Cloud Machine Learning at Google. When he‚Äôs not teaching machine learning at Google, he likes to teach machine learning at his hands-on data science meetup, Central London Data Science Project Nights. Although he works in the cloud, most of his hobby projects look at different ways you can embed machine learning into low-power devices like Raspberry Pis and Arduinos. He also likes to have a bit of banter with his mixed tag rugby teams.

üîò Polong Lin ‚Äì Machine learning at scale with BigQuery, Colab and AI Platform notebooks on Google Cloud

How can data scientists scale their machine learning pipelines with minimal data engineering overhead? Polong Lin (Developer Advocate, Google) will discuss how BigQuery ML, Colab and AI Platform can be used together to help businesses accelerate their growth with data.

Polong is a Developer Advocate at Google, based in London, UK, with a focus on data science and machine learning. Due to his background in psychology, Polong gets particularly excited about data science projects at the intersection of data science and human behaviour.

üëÄüåü We are looking forward for next events, if you have topic suggestion, or want to talk we are open for speakers and sponsors ü§ù

See you at the meetup!

-- Yevgen and Mario

events.name: Online Community Speedrun Challenge ‚Äì Google Developer Essentials
events.description:
We are thrilled to join online Community Speedrun Challenge that Google is organizing for developer communities in Europe.

The Community Speedrun Challenge is a training program that will run in February where you‚Äôll have the opportunity to get hands-on experience with tools like GCP, AutoML and Cloud Run.

Every Speedrun is open for a week to give you the ability to finish all labs in your best time, scoring more points and winning prizes.

Webinar Time: Tuesday, February 18, from 7pm to 9pm (GMT+1)

Find more information and register here: https://bit.ly/speedrunchallenge0220
